group_1.textLeft: Oh wow, there's an arcade here too!

group_1.textRight: They finally finished the renovations and reopened@the other day.

group_1.textLeft: ...Huh?@I don't think I've ever seen this cabinet before.
Is this the latest rhythm game?

group_1.textRight: It wasn't here before the renovation.@Must've arrived just in time for the opening.

group_1.textLeft: There's the latest zombie game over there...
Been a while since I've played one of those...!
Though, I really need to save money...

group_1.textRight: Yeah, that's a problem.

group_1.textLeft: Me too...
I just ate a parfait, so I'm out of allowance again...

group_1.textRight: You wanna play the games too, Rena?

group_1.textLeft: Well, yeah, at least one of each.
Before the renovation, this place had only@old-fashioned games and crappy prizes.
Didn't feel like playing.

group_1.textRight: Right.

group_1.textLeft: I heard the old games were the former owner's@interest.
Since the owner was replaced and the place was@renovated, I guess they must've been unpopular.
Whether it's the old cabinets, or the owner's@obsession with old things...
There's a certain flavor to this place.

group_1.textRight: Huh?

group_1.textLeft: For example, some of the oldest machines, which@are considered the originals of arcade games...
...have been in operation since long before@we were born.

group_1.textRight: Oh? Some of them are that old?

group_1.textLeft: Mhmm.
We might call them games, but they're still@very much antique-level.
With an owner who let us play@such valuable games casually...
...retro games that may look old@can be just as hot if you give it a try.
I really feel that whether new or old...
...the gimmick to entertain customers is the same.
I believe all games are interesting.

group_1.textRight: Ah, I see it now...
Amazing, Ranka!
You know so much about stores and games alike...!
Ranka, you're more than just a gamer, aren't you?

group_1.textLeft: Well... I mean, the arcade in my hometown was@in a similar situation.
Since it was in the interest of the owner, he only@kept old cabinets in the place...
But the sales were so low that not only the cabinets,@but also the equipment, were falling apart.
The number of customers was dwindling, and@the store was on the verge of closing down.
But, I got to know gaming at that arcade, so...

group_1.textRight: ...it was a really precious place to you, huh?

group_1.textLeft: Mhm, I was determined to protect it.
"I want that arcade to become a sacred land@so that it never goes out of business."
That's what I wished for when I became@a Magical Girl.

group_1.textRight: I had no idea...
You're more of a gamer than a gamer—@you're an arcade enthusiast at heart!

group_1.textLeft: Well, yeah.

group_1.textRight: I wanna go to that place—@the arcade protected by Ranka!
Where's your hometown again, Ranka?
I wonder if it can be searched up online?

group_1.textLeft: Ah...

group_1.textCenter: (I got carried away by these girls' pace...!)

group_1.textLeft: Oh, that's been enough about me already...

group_1.textRight: That's right!@We came here to compete!
...But, just one round.@I don't have enough money...

group_1.textLeft: Well then, how about we play that zombie game@over there?
The one with the higher score wins.

group_1.textRight: Zombie...?!
...O-okay.@Let's do this!
Oh God, I'm never doing that again!@I'd literally rather die!

group_1.textLeft: If you were dead, couldn't you just become@a zombie and attack the player?

group_1.textRight: I TOLD you, I'm never doing that again!
Rena, you must've been really scared...

group_1.textLeft: I guess this was bigger than the gaming match...

group_1.textRight: This reaction...a Witch!@Momoko! Kaede!

group_1.textLeft: Alright, let's go!

group_1.textRight: Yeah...!
Ranka, you're a noob.@If you're scared, you can stay here.

group_1.textLeft: (Oh right, that was the setup...)
...Nope. I'll go with you.
